intro: Pseudomertensia trollii, commonly known as the Troll's ghostplant, is a rare and elusive flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, elongated leaves and showy, tubular flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is often found in remote, inaccessible areas. Its unique morphology and restricted range make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists alike.
